segment.source: How to Edit an Existing Virtual Application
segment.target: How to Edit an Existing Virtual Application

segment.source: How to Edit an Existing Virtual Application
segment.target: How to Edit an Existing Virtual Application

segment.source: How to Edit an Existing Virtual Application
segment.target: How to Edit an Existing Virtual Application

segment.source: You can use the following procedure to edit the properties associated with an existing virtual application package by using the Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer.
segment.target: You can use the following procedure to edit the properties associated with an existing virtual application package by using the Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer.

segment.source: You must open the existing virtual application, make the necessary updates, and then save the updated virtual application package.
segment.target: You must open the existing virtual application, make the necessary updates, and then save the updated virtual application package.

segment.source: To modify an existing virtual application
segment.target: To modify an existing virtual application

segment.source: To start the App-V Sequencer Console, on the computer running the App-V Sequencer, select StartProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: To start the App-V Sequencer Console, on the computer running the App-V Sequencer, select StartProgramsMicrosoft Application VirtualizationMicrosoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: To open the existing virtual application, in the App-V Console, select FileOpen.
segment.target: To open the existing virtual application, in the App-V Console, select FileOpen.

segment.source: Use the Open dialog box to locate the associated SPRJ file you want to modify.
segment.target: Use the Open dialog box to locate the associated SPRJ file you want to modify.

segment.source: For more information about what properties can be modified, see How to Determine Whether to Edit or Upgrade a Virtual Application Package.
segment.target: For more information about what properties can be modified, see How to Determine Whether to Edit or Upgrade a Virtual Application Package.

segment.source: To save the modifications, select FileSave.
segment.target: To save the modifications, select FileSave.

segment.source: How to Create or Upgrade Virtual Applications Using the App-V Sequencer
segment.target: How to Create or Upgrade Virtual Applications Using the App-V Sequencer

segment.source: How to Upgrade an Existing Virtual Application
segment.target: How to Upgrade an Existing Virtual Application
